channel.title: yosys on Project F
channel.description: Recent content in yosys on Project F

item.title: iCE40 FPGA Toolchain on Linux
item.description: In this post, I provide a quick guide to building an open-source FPGA toolchain for iCE40 boards, such as iCEBreaker, on Linux. This guide is designed for Ubuntu or Pop!_OS 20.04, but should be straightforward to adjust to your own distro.

item.title: FPGA Tooling on Ubuntu 20.04
item.description: In this post, I test common FPGA tools for compatibility with Ubuntu 20.04 (AKA Focal Fossa), and my regular desktop OS: Pop!_OS 20.04. These tests are in no way exhaustive: I have tried using the applications as I usually do to exercise the main functionality. I have also included instructions for building the tools from source when available.
